snippet: Stanford University researchers concluded that fruits, vegetables and meat labeled organic were, on average, no more nutritious than their conventional counterparts.
abstract: Stanford University researchers conclude that fruits, vegetables and meat labeled organic are, on average, no more nutritious than their conventional counterparts and are not any less likely to be contaminated with dangerous bacteria.
lead_paragraph: Stanford University researchers concluded that fruits, vegetables and meat labeled organic were, on average, no more nutritious than their conventional counterparts.

headline.seo: Study Questions Advantages of Organic Meat and Produce
headline.main: Stanford Scientists Cast Doubt on Advantages of Organic Meat and Produce
headline.print_headline: Stanford Scientists Cast Doubt on Advantages of Organic Meat and Produce
